question.title: Getting 0 from response.getHits().getTotalHits() while hits are clearly present in the response
question.body:
I'm trying to retrieve the total number of hits from a query using a matchAllQuery, but I'm getting 0 when calling response.getHits().getTotalHits(), even though the response indicates that there are hits present.

BoolQueryBuilder qb = new BoolQueryBuilder();
SearchSourceBuilder searchSourceBuilder = new SearchSourceBuilder();
SearchRequest searchRequest = new SearchRequest(indexName);
searchRequest.types("data");

qb.should(QueryBuilders.matchAllQuery());
searchSourceBuilder.query(qb);
searchSourceBuilder.trackTotalHits(true);

searchRequest.source(searchSourceBuilder);
SearchResponse response = indexManager.list(searchRequest);


SearchHits hits = response.getHits(); 
long totalHits = hits.getTotalHits();
System.out.println("totalHits " + totalHits);
  
SearchHit[] searchHit = hits.getHits();
System.out.println("searchHit length : " + searchHit.length);

Output:

totalHits 0
searchHit length : 811

Using Elasticsearch 6.5.4, so I cannot use hits.getTotalHits().value and currently I'm not able to upgrade to 7.x

Debugging variables tab

I tried with and without using trackTotalHits(true), but that did not a make difference.

I tried with different queries like match query, match phrase query, prefix query and getting 0 total hits for all of them.

I tried with and without setting searchSourceBuilder size and from but getting zero for both.

answers.body: Turns out we had different versions of Elasticsearch running for test and production for some reason. Test was on version 7 while production was on version 6. So i changed the versions of rest high level client and elastic search dependencies in pom.xml to version 7 and was able to get correct hits for testing by using hits.getTotalHits().value.
